general_provisions: This bill addresses congregate care programs.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Congregate Care Admissions Committee (committee);<hr><ltbullet>authorizes and directs the committee to:<hr><ltbullet1>set minimum safety requirements for congregate care programs;<hr><ltbullet1>review proposed admissions criteria a program submits in connection with the program's application for or renewal of licensure;<hr><ltbullet1>deny or accept proposed admissions criteria;<hr><ltbullet>creates the position of congregate care ombudsman (ombudsman);<hr><ltbullet>authorizes and directs the ombudsman to receive and investigate reported concerns regarding congregate care programs;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Licensed Provider Civil Money Penalty Fund;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes and directs the Division of Licensing and Background Processing (division) to regulate congregate care programs;<hr><ltbullet>denies direct access qualified status for individuals who are or have been under investigation for sexual misconduct within the past three years;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for congregate care programs, including that the programs:<hr><ltbullet1>adopt admissions criteria by which to determine whether an individual child is a qualified candidate for the congregate care program;<hr><ltbullet1>maintain a list of a child's authorized contacts who may contact the child if the child is in crisis;<hr><ltbullet1>notify the authorized contacts and the parent or guardian of a child who is in crisis;<hr><ltbullet1>post notice within the program stating that clients and staff may report a complaint or concern regarding the congregate care program to the ombudsman;<hr><ltbullet1>provide a dedicated telephone from which a child or staff at a program may contact the ombudsman at any time;<hr><ltbullet1>provide disclosures to a child, the child's parent or guardian, and the child's authorized contacts;<hr><ltbullet>establishes responsibility for payment to a health care facility that provides services to a child, including transportation costs;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the office to collect a fee; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes whistleblower protections for individuals who report a concern to, or who facilitate or cooperate with, the ombudsman; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
